feed.title: Hunger Games Soundtrack News: The Civil Wars Preview "Kingdom Come"
feed.subtitle: Is "Kingdom Come" the best song on The Hunger Games Soundtrack? Better, even, than songs by Arcade Fire and The Decemberists? The Civil Wars think so.

category.term: 2763~Entertainment Weekly~The Hunger Games~The Civil Wars~Taylor Swift
category.label: InformQString

content.div:
While we've spent most of the day refreshing and refreshing our browser, desperate for the Hunger Games red carpet to begin, The Hunger Games Soundtrack doesn't actually arrive until March 20. Still, there are at least two people in the world -- our modern-day, not in the least bit dystopian world -- who have heard it, John Paul White and Joy Williams of the Civil Wars.

The rustic folk duo contribute two songs to the collection -- they feature on the previously released Taylor Swift single "Safe and Sound" and also appear on a tune called "Kingdom Come" -- but when it comes to the collection's 14 other songs, White would only share this review: "I think ours are better," he joked to Entertainment Weekly. "Let the headline be: The Civil Wars Are Carrying the Rest of the Artists on the Soundtrack on Their Backs."

There's something oh-so Hunger Games about that image -- but still, these Grammy winners have killer company on the upcoming soundtrack, what with Arcade Fire, The Decemberists, Neko Case, Kid Cudi and Miranda Lambert included on the tracklisting. Are we going to have to call shenanigans on these two? We'd hate to do it -- but it seems we can turn the decision making over to you. A 90-second preview of The Civil Wars' "Kingdom Come" debuted on Entertainment Weekly today, and while we're still short on Hunger Games Soundtrack previews -- only "Safe and Sound," The Decemberists’ “One Engine” and Arcade Fire's "Abraham's Daughter" have surfaced so far -- we expect that won't stop you from deciding whether "Kingdom Come" will be the best of the bunch.

"It's our homage to a survival song," Williams told Entertainment Weekly of the piece.

"And also to trying to keep your cool and stay rational in a ridiculous situation,” White added. “It’s a little bit of ‘It’s going to be OK, it’s going to be all right, we’re going to make it through this,’ even when the situation around you is more dire than you’d care to admit. I think it’s how we all cope.”

Listen to a preview of The Civil Wars' "Kingdom Come" at EW.com. The Hunger Games soundtrack arrives March 20. Full tracklisting below.

The Hunger Games: Songs From District 12 and Beyond:

1. Taylor Swift (Feat. The Civil Wars) – “Safe & Sound”

2. Taylor Swift – “Eyes Wide Open”

3. Arcade Fire – “Abraham’s Daughter”

4. Kid Cudi – “The Ruler & The Killer”

5. Miranda Lambert (Feat. Pistol Annies) – “Run Daddy Run”

6. The Civil Wars – “Kingdom Come”

7. The Decemberists – “One Engine”

8. Glen Hansard – “Take the Heartland”

9. The Low Anthem – “Lover is Childlike”

10. Punch Brothers – “Dark Days”

11. Secret Sisters – “Tomorrow Will Be Kinder”

12. Birdy – “Just a Game”

13. Ella Mae Bowen – “Oh Come & Sing”

14. Jayme Dee – “Rules”

15. Carolina Chocolate Drops – “Reaping Day”

16. Neko Case – “Give Me Something I’ll Remember”

leahc@dose.ca

link.Abstract: Taylor Swift always looks surprised in photos. But here's some news that really deserves an OMG-face: Swift was forced to cancel a series of concert dates due to bronchitis. Yikes! Get well soon, Swifty. It's time you built up your strength. Here, have a sandwich. In fact, have 10. We hope Swift's feeling better in time for her July 14 show in Montreal.
link.title: Gallery: Eat a Sandwich, Taylor Swift

entry.title: Photos: Hunger Games Primer

link.Abstract: Consult this handy cheat sheet to brush up on your Hunger Games knowledge.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: The Hunger Games movie is about to hit, and it's poised to make the Twilight phenomenon look like a box office blip. But what if you don't know your Panem from your Primrose, and can't tell the difference between a jabberjay and a tracker jacker? Don't worry, we've got you covered. Consult this handy cheat sheet and brush up on your HG trivia before the film is released. -Jen McDonnell/Dose.ca
link.Credit: The Hunger Games: Official Illustrated Movie Companion

entry.title: 2012 Grammy Awards - Best and Worst Moments

link.Abstract: It's music's biggest -- and longest -- night. Adele, Foo Fighters, Whitney Houston and more made for some of the most memorable moments of the 54th Annual Grammy Awards.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract:
As music's biggest night, the Grammys' mantra has always been about paying tribute to music's biggest stars. Typically, though, they're in the audience -- collecting more trophies than their Versace-clad arms can carry. That was certainly true of Sunday's edition -- with the likes of Adele, Kanye West and the Foo Fighters being lauded. But there was a heavy note to this year's show, broadcast the day after Whitney Houston's passing. The six-time Grammy winner was remembered throughout the evening, but that didn't stop the 54th Annual Grammy Awards from being the marathon, three and a half hour party it always is. Check out some of the highlights.
--Leah Collins/Dose.ca
link.title: As music's biggest night, the Grammys' mantra has always been about paying tribute to music's biggest stars. Typically, though, they're in the audience -- collecting more trophies than their Versace-clad arms can carry. But there was a heavy note to this year's show, broadcast the day after Whitney Houston's passing. The six-time Grammy winner was remembered throughout the evenin
